question:
Being a celebrity- such as a famous film star or sports personality- brings problems as well as benefits.

Do you think that being a celebrity brings more benefits or more problems?
text: It always looks surprised when we see the celebrities like actors,singers or comedians living a luxurious life, but it is only  one side of the picture. They have to face many problems too in their daily life. In this essay, I will explain  both sides of the story.

First of all, Film stars have a lot of money that they can use to spend anywhere they want. They can buy  expensive clothes, can go to the high rate restaurants, do world tours etc. However, they have the power of money but on the other hand, only a few of them have  mental peace. They cannot go to the public areas anytime they need. They want  security every time they go outside.

Secondly, if we talk about any sports personality then the same things happen to them. For example, we all are very aware of Shahid khan Afridi, who is the former Pakistan ODI and T20 team captain. Whenever he goes  shopping or any other activity, he always takes his security with him. The personal life of these celebrities is almost nothing because anything they do got viral in no time. The current time is the time of the internet when anything gets famous in seconds. That is why  being a superstar is a bit difficult for celebrities

To conclude, being a celebrity is beneficial as well as hard for film stars or sports personalities. It is good in terms of fame, money and power and bad in terms of personal life that get disturbed because of fame.
